properties.description: Enter the DOI of the Dataset
properties.title: DOI

properties.description: The main researchers involved in producing the data, or the authors of the publication, in priority order.
properties.title: Names (Creators)

properties.description:
The name of the creator.
The personal name format should be: family, given.
properties.title: Name

properties.description:
Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.
Provide an ORCID identifier for the creator identified.
properties.title: ORCID Identifier

properties.description: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the creator.
properties.title: Affiliation

properties.description: A name or title by which a resource is known.
properties.title: Title

properties.description:
The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes,releases, issues, or produces the resource.
This property will be used to formulate the citation, so consider the prominence of the role.
properties.title: Publisher

properties.description:
The year when the data was or will be made publicly available.
Enter in the format YYYY
properties.title: Publication Year

properties.description: Subject, keyword, classification code, or key phrase describing the resource.
properties.title: Subjects

properties.description: Examples: LCSH, Dewey, MESH...
properties.title: subjectScheme

properties.description: The institution or person responsible for collecting, managing, distributing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the resource.
properties.title: Names (Contributors)

properties.description:
Name of the contributor.
The personal name format should be: family, given.
properties.title: Name

properties.description:
Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.
Provide an ORCID identifier for the creator identified.
properties.title: ORCID Identifier

properties.description: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the contributor.
properties.title: Affiliation

properties.description: The type of contributor of the resource. See the DataCite documentation for a description of types.
properties.title: Type of Contributor

properties.description:
Different dates relevant to the work.
Enter in the format YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD.
For definitions of types see the DataCite documentation.

options.index: If a date is provided please select a type.

properties.title: Type of Date

properties.description:
The primary language of the resource.
Allowed values are taken from IETF BCP 47, ISO639‐1 language codes.
properties.title: Language

properties.description: A description of the resource.
properties.title: Resource Type

options.index: If you have entered a value for Resource Type, please select a General Type

properties.description: An identifier or identifiers other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered. This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. May be used for local identifiers.
properties.title: Alternate Identifier

properties.description:
The type of alternate identifier.
If AlternateIdentifier is used, alternateIdentifierType is mandatory. For the above example, the alternateIdentifierType would be “A local accession number”.
properties.title: Alternate Identifier Type

properties.description: An identifier or identifiers other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered. This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. May be used for local identifiers.

Identifiers of related resources.
These must be globally unique identifiers.
properties.title: Related Identifiers

properties.description: The type of related identifier.

options.index: If RelatedIdentifier is used, relatedIdentifierType is mandatory.

properties.title: Related Identifier Type

properties.description: Description of the relationship of the resource being registered (A) and the related resource (B).

options.index: If RelatedIdentifier is used, relationType is mandatory.

properties.title: Relation Type

properties.description:
Unstructured size information about the resource.
Examples: "15 pages", "6 MB"
properties.title: Sizes

properties.description:
Technical format of the resource.
Use file extension or MIME type where possible, e.g., PDF, XML, MPG or application/pdf, text/xml, video/mpeg.
properties.title: Formats

properties.description: The version number of the resource.
properties.title: Version

properties.description: Any rights information for this resource.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: The URI of the license.
properties.title: rightsURI

properties.description: The URI of the license.

options.index: If Description is used, descriptionType is mandatory.

properties.title: Description Type

properties.description: Spatial region or named place where the data was gathered or about which the data is focused.
properties.title: Geo Locations

properties.description:
A point location in space.
A point contains a single latitude‐longitude pair, separated by whitespace.
properties.title: geoLocationPoint

properties.description:
The spatial limits of a place.
A box contains two white space separated latitude ‐ longitude pairs, with each pair separated by whitespace. The first pair is the lower corner (normally south west), the second is the upper corner (normally north east).
properties.title: geoLocationBox

properties.description:
Description of a geographic location.
Use to describe a geographic location.
properties.title: geoLocationPlace
